question.text: What map unit (Centimorgan) is adopted in the construction of genetic maps?

options.text: A unit of distance between two expressed genes, representing 10% cross over.
A unit of distance between two expressed genes, representing 100% cross over.
A unit of distance between genes on chromosomes, representing 1% cross over.
A unit of distance between genes on chromosomes, representing 50% cross over.

solution.text: 1 map unit or centimorgan is equivalent to <math><mn>1</mn><mi>%</mi></math> recombination between two genes. If was Sturtevant who first suggest that frequency of recombination can be used to depict relative distance between the genes. <math><mn>10</mn><mi>%</mi></math> crossing over is known as Morgan (M)
